subject: Re: [junit] How to Test Private Methods Inside a Class
msgSnippet: No problem, I met a lot of Java programmers that did not know that and still were able to produce really good designs so it can t be that important. But it is
messageBody:
No problem,

I met a lot of Java programmers that did not know that and still were able
to produce really good designs so it can't be that important. But it is nice
to know :)

Glad I could help out!
/J


On 7/25/06, Cédric Beust ♔ <cbeust@...> wrote:
>
> On 7/25/06, Joakim Ohlrogge <joakim.ohlrogge@...<joakim.ohlrogge%40gmail.com>>
> wrote:
> >
> >
> >
> > I meant exactly what I wrote and, no it does not work as you think. It
> > is a common missunderstanding. Protected methods can be used from
> > *any* method in the same package *and* from subclasses derived from
> > the class declaring the protected member.
>
> Indeed, I didn't know that... Learn something every day.
>
> Thanks for pointing it out!
>
>
> --
> Cédric
> http://testng.org
>
> [Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
>
>
>


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
